title_it:
The word "shame" is a single-word poem by the American poet Ralph Waldo Emerson. It succinctly captures the complex emotion of shame, bringing to mind feelings of self-blame, inadequacy, and vulnerability. As a translator, I would render this single word into Italian as:

Vergogna.
poem_en: Ashamed— not of who I am, but what we’ve come to mean. Now I’m searching for new work, finding my way out of the machine.
poem_it: Vergognandomi— non di chi sono, ma del significato che abbiamo assunto. Ora sto cercando un nuovo percorso, trovando la via d'uscita dalla macchina.
